result.execSummary:
Brandon L. Taylor was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Brandon L. Taylor was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon L. Taylor

defendant.name: Taylor, Brandon L.
defendant.address: N89 W15322 Jefferson Avenue, Menomonee Falls, WI 53051

records.addlTxt:
2:18 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Brandon L. Taylor in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant is heard. 

Court provides a copy of the criminal complaint of extradition, Anoka County, State of Minnesota. 
Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained. 

Court reviews waiver of extradition form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. 
Defendant agrees to waiver of extradition. Defendant initials complaint. 

Defendant signs waiver of extradition. 
Court finds defendants waiver of extradition has been made freely, knowingly and voluntarily. 

Court certifies and signs waiver. Court provides a copy to the defendant. Sheriffs department will contact Anoka county to make arrangements for transfer. 
Defendant is heard.
